subclassFeature.name: Blood Knight
entries: The blood knight is the title given to an eldritch knight who chooses to delve into the taboo discipline of hemomancy, or the magic of controlling blood and life force. These warriors thrive in the heart of battle where the blood flows thickest, using it to enhance their offensive and defensive capabilities.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Hemomancy
entries: Starting at 3rd level when you choose this archetype, you gain access to a series of techniques that allow you to use the blood of your enemies to your advantage.

When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you gain a special die called a blood die. This die is a {@dice d6}. Each subsequent attack you hit with gains you an additional blood die to a maximum equal to your proficiency modifier.

You can expend a number of blood die to perform a number of hemomantic abilities described below. Each time an ability asks you to expend your blood dice, you can choose how many you want to roll and gain a benefit based on what you rolled. You do not gain blood dice from attacks that are modified by the blood dice.

subclassFeature.name: Sense Life
entries: At 7th level, you gain advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks to spot and track enemies that have blood in their veins.
In addition, your ability to sense blood can be so precise that you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks to tell if someone is lying to you.

subclassFeature.name: Blood-Fueled Overdrive
entries: At 10th level, when you use your Indomitable feature, you can expend one blood die and add it to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Hemomantic Precision
entries: At 15th level, you have a very tight control over blood you spill. You can re-roll one blood die whenever you roll them for a hemomantic ability.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Tyrant
entries: At 18th level, when you hit a creature with an attack and have the maximum amount of blood dice, you can expend them all to {@condition paralyzed|paralyze} the target until the start of your next turn.
A creature with legendary resistances can use one to resist the effects of this ability.

optionalfeature.name: Combat Regeneration
entries: At the start of your turn, you can expend your blood dice to gain temporary hit points equal to the amount you roll.

optionalfeature.name: Crimson Strike
entries: When you use your {@action Attack} action, you can choose to trade one of your attacks to be able to use your blood dice in place of your weapon. When you do so, you can make a melee weapon attack with solidified blood that has a reach of 15 feet, uses your normal attack modifier, and deals damage equal to the amount you roll with blood dice you chose to expend.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Shell
entries: When you are hit with an attack, you can use your reaction to expend blood dice and increase your AC by an amount that you roll against that attack.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Clotting
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend blood dice to throw blood onto a surface and have it stick in a 5x5 area. Any creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a Strength saving throw with a DC of 10 + the amount you roll on yoru blood dice (to a maximum of 20) or have their speed reduced to zero until the start of their next turn.
